business.headline: Sensex, Nifty end lower after hitting record highs as financial stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 264.27 points lower at 85,571.85, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 37.10 points lower at 26,178.95.

Swiggy files for Rs 10,000 crore IPO: Here's all you need to knowSwiggy's IPO will consist of two main parts: a fresh issue of equity shares worth Rs 3,750 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 18.52 crore shares by existing stakeholders.

India once had a Rs 10,000 note. Know why it was discontinuedThe history of India's Rs 10,000 note dates back to the pre-independence era. In 1938, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) issued its first Rs 10,000 note, the largest denomination ever printed in the country.
What are multi-asset funds and are they good for your investment portfolio?Multi-asset funds are schemes that invest in a combination of three or more assets, such as equities, bonds, and gold.
China boosts exports: Will it hurt India, other global markets?With a slowing domestic economy, China is looking to global markets to absorb its excess production.

Real estate multibagger stock soars 260% in 1 year since IPO. Have you invested?Since its debut on the stock exchanges on September 27, 2023, the stock has outperformed not only its peers but also the broader real estate market.
Swipe, spend, struggle: How credit card defaults are spiking in IndiaOnce a symbol of freedom, credit cards now trap young Indians in growing debt. Could defaults be the new norm?

KRN Heat Exchanger IPO: Check latest GMP, subscription status, other detailsKRN Heat Exchanger opened for subscription on September 25 looking to raise Rs 341.95 crore from its public issue, and has already seen bids of over 80 times.

Accenture guidance boost lifts Infosys, Wipro; IT stocks rally up to 4%Accenture not only exceeded market expectations for its Q4 results but also raised its revenue guidance for FY25 to a range of 3-6%.

Isha, Akash Ambani among top young entrepreneurs in Hurun's under-35 listThe Hurun list celebrates 150 entrepreneurs aged 35 or younger from across India, marking their achievements in fields ranging from retail to tech startups.
Sensex, Nifty hit record high for 6th straight sessionThe S&P BSE Sensex added 67.47 points to 85,903.59, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 14.70 points to 26,230.75.

Swiggy files for IPO, aims to raise about Rs 3,750 croreSwiggy, backed by investment group Prosus and Japan's SoftBank, competes with Zomato in India's online restaurant and cafe food deliveries sector.

Will Middle East conflict dampen Dalal Street's rally? Here's what experts say Despite the uncertainty arising from the Middle East conflict, Indian stocks have surged, with benchmarks like the Sensex and Nifty showing strong gains.

Vedanta shares cross Rs 500 mark after gaining 5%. More gains ahead?Vedanta's performance in 2024 has been impressive, with the stock climbing 95% so far this year and gaining 124.35% over the last 12 months. Over a five-year period, the stock has risen by 202%.
Sensex, Nifty close at all-time high led by rally in auto and metal stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 666.25 points to end at 85,836.12, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 211.90 points to close at 26,216.05.
Tata Steel shares gain for 5th straight session. What should investors do?In the past year, Tata Steel has rallied 28%, with an 18% gain so far in 2024.

Trent shares surge to record high on Citi's 'buy' call. Check detailsCiti set a target price of Rs 9,250 for the stock, signaling a 21% upside from the previous closing price, and added it to its Pan-Asia high-conviction focus list.

Puneet Chhatwal eyes top 3 spot for Taj Hotels in global hospitalityHe envisions the brand securing its place among the top three global hospitality companies in the next five years, a goal driven by Taj's ethos of service, adaptability to changing luxury trends, and a commitment to sustainable growth.

80% of your portfolio should be 'Dal-Chawal': Radhika Gupta's investment mantraRadhika Gupta's message focused on the importance of disciplined, long-term investing—what she calls "Dal-Chawal Investing"—a simple and sustainable approach she believes will help investors navigate the market's highs and lows.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Lokayukta registers case against Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah in land scamIn a major legal challenge for Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, the Mysuru Lokayukta on Friday registered a case against him in connection with the alleged MUDA land scam.

Silent spectators: Supreme Court blasts air quality panel over Delhi pollutionPulling up the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM), the Supreme Court said not a single committee was formed to tackle the stubble burning issue.

Jagan Reddy cancels visit to Tirupati temple amid 'animal fat' in laddu rowYSR Congress Party (YSRCP) Chief and former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has cancelled his planned visit to Tirumala amid the controversy over allegations that animal fat was used in the preparation of the temple's prasadam laddus.

'Human sacrifice' in UP, Class 2 boy strangled to bring 'glory to school'The alleged motive behind the murder was to ensure the prosperity of the school, which had been under financial strain. The accused believed that offering a human sacrifice would lead to the school's success.
What doctors say about Rapamycin, the magic pill that can 'extend your life'Rapamycin has gained significant attention from 'longevity experts' as the key to a longer, healthier life.

Devara Part 1 review: Jr NTR, Saif Ali Khan shoulder predictable action dramaReleased-Fri Sep 27, 2024Devara Part 1 movie review: Director Koratala Siva's Devara Part 1, starring Jr NTR and Saif Ali Khan, is an action drama with elaborate characterisations. The film features strong performances from Jr NTR and Saif Ali Khan, but the story remains predictable.

Canada MP slams 'Khalistan extremists' over fresh Kanishka bombing probe pleaIn an address to the Canadian Parliament, Chandra Arya said two public inquiries had already found Khalistan extremists responsible for the bombing of Air India 'Kanishka' flight.

For British pension, Bahadur Shah Zafar plotted against sepoys in 1857Indian sepoys who had raised the flag of revolt in 1857 reached Red Fort and urged Bahadur Shah Zafar to be the symbolic head of their fight. The last Mughal emperor, living off a pension from the British, wrote letters to the British conspiring against the Indian sepoys. A look at the pension worries of Bahadur Shah Zafar amid 21st century India's pension conundrum.
Video: Moment Dart spacecraft crashed into asteroid intentionallyThe target of DART's impact was Dimorphos, a small moonlet orbiting the larger asteroid Didymos.

Why Sunil Jakhar isn't keen on continuing as Punjab BJP chiefSunil Jakhar has offered to resign as Punjab BJP chief twice, citing dissatisfaction with the party's internal leadership, factionalism, and interference in his authority.

Loved her, she wanted to trap me: Bengaluru murder accused confessed to motherPolice sources said after killing Mahalakshmi, the accused went to his home in Odisha, after almost three years, and confessed to the crime before his mother.

India's bid for permanent UN Security Council seat gets major push UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Thursday backed India for a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) during his address at the United Nations General Assembly's 79th session in New York.

Flipkart apologises for video calling husbands 'aalsi, bewakoof' after backlashThe video, promoting Flipkart's 'Big Billion Days Sale,' has since been removed from their social media platforms after the backlash.

Torrent Pharmaceuticals, Alkem refute claims of their drugs failing quality testTorrent Pharmaceuticals and Alkem Laboratories reject CDSCO's claims of their drugs failing quality tests, asserting that the samples in question were "spurious" and not genuine.

Vishnu Manchu to Prakash Raj over Tirupati laddu row: Not everything is your fightActor Vishnu Manchu addressed his social media exchange with Prakash Raj over the Tirupati laddu adulteration controversy, defending Pawan Kalyan's call for an investigation.

2nd Test: Akash Deep stars as rain halts India charge, Bangladesh resistanceAkash Deep was the star of the show on Day 1 of the Kanpur Test as India's charge was halted by rain and a fine fightback from Bangladesh, led by Mominul Haque on September 27, Friday.

Watch: IAS officer Tina Dabi scolds shopkeepers during cleanliness drive in BarmerTina Dabi, who was appointed District Collector of Barmer earlier this month, conducted a cleanliness assessment with administrative staff earlier this week to evaluate the city's sanitation efforts.

Pinched my nose, choked me: Boy who survived UP school 'human sacrifice' earlierThe child, whose identity has been protected for safety reasons, revealed that Bhagat, the father of the school's manager, had attempted to suffocate him by pinching his nose and choking him.

Why Turkey's Erdogan skipped Kashmir in speech, rattled Pakistan | ExplainedTurkey's President Erdogan omits Kashmir in his UNGA speech. What could signal a potential shift in Turkey's stance, is seen as a blow to Pakistan, and it's futile 'activism' for Kashmir. The move could be linked to Turkey's aspirations to join the BRICS group, and strengthening ties with India.

Who flooded Waqf Bill JPC's mailbox?The huge number of suggestions that the Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) on the Waqf (Amendment) Bill received has sparked a controversy. Panel member and BJP MP Nishikant Dubey sought a probe into the role of China or Pakistan's ISI over the 1.25 crore submissions. The All India Muslim Personal Law Board said Muslims had sent 5 crore feedback to the JPC against the bill.

Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 teaser X reactions: Fans celebrate Diwali early with ManjulikaSocial media users welcomed the teaser of Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 on Friday, September 27, and celebrated the comeback of Vidya Balan to the franchise as the OG Manjulika. They complimented Kartik Aaryan for bringing entertainment this Diwali.

Jr NTR fan travels from Japan to US to meet him, his reaction is pricelessIn a heartfelt video shared online, actor Jr NTR is observed having an adorable interaction with a Japanese fan at his recent appearance at Beyond Fest 2024 held in Los Angeles.

Veer Savarkar can be independent submission, not official Oscar entry: FFI PresidentLaapataa Ladies was announced as India's official Oscars entry. However, a social media post by the makers of Swatantrya Veer Savarkar caused confusion. The FFI President clarified that only one film could be submitted.

Actors Namkoong Min, Jeon Yeo-been to star in New K-Drama 'Our Movie'A new Korean drama titled Our Movie has been announced, featuring Namkoong Min and Jeon Yeo-been in the lead roles. The drama explores themes of life, ambition, and artistic expression.

sports.headline: Ashwin and Jadeja will dictate the outcomes of Tests during BGT: Glenn MaxwellAustralia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has said that the Indian spin duo of Ravichandran and Ravindra Jadeja will determine the result of the Border Gavaskar Trophy 2024-25.

Watch: Kanpur police escort Bangladesh fan 'Tiger Robi' to hospital Tiger Robi,' the passionate Bangladesh cricket fan, was carried off the stands by security officials on Day 1 of the second Test between India and Bangladesh. According to police sources, Tiger Robi's health deteriorated on Friday morning, requiring immediate hospital admission due to dehydration.

Ashwin now has 420 wickets in the Asian continent, second only to Muttiah Muralitharan's 612.

Neeraj Chopra targets return to peak fitness, World Championship glory in 2025 Neeraj Chopra said he is confident of returning to 100 percent fitness at the start of the next season. The double Olympic medalist was battling with a groin injury throughout the 2024 season.

SL vs NZ: Kamindu Mendis continues golden Test run, scores 5th Test hundredKamindu Mendis continued his golden run in Test cricket as he scored his 5th hundred on Day 2 of the Galle Test on Friday, September 27. Kamindu got to his hundred in 147 balls against New Zealand.

Ravi Shastri shares special post with 'Raghu Bhaiya' ahead Kanpur TestFormer India coach Ravi Shastri praised the team's throwdown specialist, Raghuvendra Diwedi, known as "Raghu Bhaiya," ahead of the second Test against Bangladesh. Shastri highlighted Raghu's crucial role in preparing India's top batters to face high-speed bowling challenges.

Manu Bhaker doubles down on trolls, flaunts room full of medals in heartwarming postDouble Olympic medalist Manu Bhaker continued to hit out at her trolls. The celebrated shooter flaunted a room of medals, which included the two bronze medals she won at the Paris Olympics.

India become first team to win toss and bowl first in Kanpur Test in 60 years India vs Bangladesh, 2nd Test: Rohit Sharma called it right at the toss and opted to field at Green Park. This is the first time in 60 years that a team has won the toss in Kanpur and opted to bowl.

Bowling coach Morne Morkel relishing India jobFormer South African pacer Morne Morkel enjoyed his first week as the bowling coach of the Indian men's cricket team during the two-match Test series against Bangladesh.

Virat Kohli faces more pressure than Smith, Root and Williamson: Parthiv, TamimParthiv Patel and Tamim Iqbal feel that Virat Kohli faces more pressure than the rest of the Fab 4 members, Steve Smith, Joe Root and Kane Williamson. Kohli has been going through a rough patch in the longest format of the game.

IPL 2025: Dwayne Bravo appointed new KKR mentor, replaces Gautam GambhirIPL 2025: Kolkata Knight Riders announced former West Indies all-rounder Dwayne Bravo as their mentor for the upcoming Indian Premier League season. Bravo's association with Chennai Super Kings, therefore, comes to an end.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
